channel.title: Softwares on Senkbeil
channel.description: Recent content in Softwares on Senkbeil

item.title: GridSide
item.description: Personal portfolio, gallery, and blog for use by the Hugo generator. Used by chipsenkbeil.com.

item.title: Spark Kernel
item.description: A Jupyter kernel written in Scala for use with Apache Spark.

item.title: Scala Debugger
item.description: A Scala wrapper library around the JDI (Java Debugger Interface).

item.title: Scala Debugger Akka Extension
item.description: Represents the Akka extension to the Scala Debugger API.

item.title: Resume
item.description: My work and academic resumes, written in LaTeX. Contains utility functions to write your own resume easily in the same format.

item.title: Dot files
item.description: My own personal collection of hidden configuration files, extra binaries, etc.

item.title: ECE4530 (Hardware/Software Codesign) - Main Project
item.description: Competition between classmates to create the fastest combination of hardware and software to perform collision detection for SHA-1 digests. Contains my design documents, drawings, source code (C/Verliog), and associated images.

item.title: ECE 4534 (Embedded Systems) - Main Project
item.description: Contains the PIC microcontroller C code used to control our rover through a maze. Does not contain the ARM code as that was written by another classmate.

item.title: tmux XMonad bindings
item.description: Contains a tmux configuration script to provide XMonad-like keyboard bindings. Also contains necessary utility functions to capture modifier keys (like shift) needed for XMonad.

item.title: ACM Website
item.description: One of my first attempts at Javascript/CSS was to create a new website for the Virginia Tech chapter of ACM.

item.title: Keyboard state
item.description: Small program written to demonstrate capturing modifier key input on Linux using the raw keyboard input device.

item.title: CS 4204 (Computer Graphics) - Project 4
item.description:
The goal of this assignment was to demonstrate an understanding of vertex and fragment shaders by using some reference code provided by the professor and writing our own vertex and fragment shader code in two external files.

Aside from minor tweaks, the only code I wrote for this assignment was the vertex and fragment shaders used to cause a slow ripple effect and map leaf textures onto the base texture.

item.title: CS 4204 (Computer Graphics) - Project 3
item.description: The goal of this assignment was to demonstrate a basic understanding of keyframes, animation, and interpolation. Based off of previous code written for project 2 (revamped to work better with animation).

item.title: CS 4204 (Computer Graphics) - Project 2
item.description: The goal of this assignment was to demonstrate a basic understanding of texture mapping, lightining, and material properties available through OpenGL and apply them to our robot. Based off of previous code written for project 1 (revamped to work better with lighting).

item.title: CS 4204 (Computer Graphics) - Project 1
item.description: The goal of this assignment was to demonstrate a basic understanding of tree-based modeling by connecting various parts of a robot together and providing a method to move different parts of the body and witness changes in one part affect its children.
